Title: Reliability Engineer - Unity, SK - Indeed.com
Description:
Reliability Engineer - (210000AR)
Description
We invite you to Explore the Potential of being part of something Clearly Essential!
At Compass Minerals, we harvest, mine and produce essential minerals that deal with nature’s challenges, including – but not limited to – highway deicing salt for the winter months, water softening salt and plant nutrition that improves the quality and yield of crops. We transform Earth’s resources that ultimately help keep people safe, feed the world and enrich lives, every day.
With our company headquarters in Overland Park, KS, Compass Minerals operates 15 production and packaging facilities with more than 2,000 employees throughout the U.S., Canada, Brazil and the U.K. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice matters. We believe in work that creates value for all stakeholders, encourages collaboration at all levels and focuses on a high-performance environment where employees are challenged to be their best.
Summary:
The Reliability Engineer role will appeal to engineering professionals that possess a diverse set of engineering skills in compliment with refine business acumen for developing short and long term capital business plans. She/He will possess a proven track record for delivering projects and increasing reliability that enable people and processes to deliver greater results in alignment to key business performance indicators. Your leadership style embraces team work and the sharing of ideas in an effort to identify progressive projects to move the business and the people within it forward. You see your role as a professional service to the business and the people within it. The Reliability Engineer will manage small to medium capital projects from conception to implementation and develop strategies to implement equipment reliability through Reliable Asset Management (RAM) and Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM). She/He will also act as the engineering support to the maintenance group as required.
Essential Job Functions:
Include but are not limited to the following:
(Management reserves the right to add or modify the duties and responsibilities at any time.)
Reliability Engineering
Reliability and CI (Continuous Improvement) initiatives site wide with a focus on overall OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness) as it pertains to Equipment Availability, Productivity Performance and Quality.
Lead ‘Fact Based’ and ‘Data Driven’ decision making through the active sponsorship and teaching of how to effectively utilize SPC (Statistical Process Control), FMEA (Failure Mode and Effect Analysis), RAM (Reliability Asset Management) and RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance) methodologies and tools.
Assist the Maintenance Team’s understanding in how best to analyze and set go-forward maintenance strategies and their required action plans based on ‘key’ data captured within the CMMS (Enterprise 1 JD Edwards - Computerized Maintenance Management System).
In partnership with the Maintenance Team review the current information being captured to ensure it is robust and meaningful enough to drive fact based decisions from.
Project Engineering
Set and monitor budgets and spending; review of major projects; prioritization of capital spend initiatives in alignment with key operations and commercialization initiatives.
In partnership with cross functional operational leadership teams, prioritize and set strategic direction for capital project plans in alignment with key performance indicators of cost, quality, productivity, reliability, efficiency, safety and customer service.
Take a lead role in ensuring initiatives are executed in an agile, efficient and prudent manner.
Ensure project scope, costs and implementation strategies are achievable and in alignment with the stated objective of the project mandate.
Create, educate and enforce engineering policies to ensure compliance to legal, corporate, quality, safety and environmental regulations.
Investigate and provide solutions to complex technical problems.
Qualifications
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's degree in an engineering discipline (mechanical, chemical, electrical, civil).
Minimum 2 years in a similar role.
Refine budget management, presentation and negotiation skills.
Consultative approach that engages participation and sharing of ideas at all levels within an organization.
Effective at leading and supervising people in a technical environment.
Ability to communicate effectively.
Exceptional at engaging, leading and focusing cross functional business teams.
Ambassador that is honest, fair, inclusive and direct in their approach to leading others.
Able to navigate through competing priorities, while maintaining positive and intact relationships.
Strong business acumen and understanding of production systems.
Exceptional trouble shooting and root cause analysis skills.
Physical Requirements:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Compass Minerals is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Compass Minerals is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, contact
913-344-9200
or email careers@compassminerals.com.

Title: CFD Analysis Engineer - Richmond, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Zinc8 Energy Solutions is developing a range of energy storage products based on a novel zinc-air flow battery technology. An expanding market for these products exists in utility, commercial, industrial, microgrid and similar applications. With powerful backing and a committed engineering nucleus, Zinc8 is expanding its product development team to capitalize on this rare opportunity.
Overview
The CFD Analysis Engineer is responsible for building and validating slurry flow and Multiphysics models throughout Zinc8’s energy storage technology components under steady state and transient conditions.
This role supports the execution of fluid management system development and scale up in assigned product and technology projects. The CFD Analysis Engineer works with key stakeholders on various aspects of particle/slurry characterization, mixing, pumping and flow distribution in fuel cell stacks and will work with the respective team leads as needed.
This role will also prepare simulations to inform design direction and optimization for all flow-related parts, geometries, and connections. The successful candidate will be expected to be able to convert CAD models to CFD models and use CFD pre-processing and post-processing tools to complete the analysis. CFD simulations are to be performed using ANSYS Fluent and/or ANSYS CFX, or other similar tools depending on the proper applicability to the particle flow modelling.
This is a Full-Time Contract position with a high possibility of an extension/turning into a permanent position for the right individual.
Key Responsibilities:
Perform computational fluid dynamics simulations to input to product design and optimize the flow and distribution of particles.
Help guide and validate particle modeling methodologies to correlate simulations to experimental data for the verification of design functions.
Collaborate with cross functional teams to determine the accuracy of completed simulations when compared to bench scale and pilot scale testing through correlation studies.
Create data and reports related to flow and discrete element simulation, and validation
Perform CFD analyses to develop and/or optimize fuel cell flow field for uniform air and electrolyte flow.
Develop CFD modelling techniques to help understand particle flow in fuel cell unit cell channels and manifolds.
Model transient behaviour of a reactor.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or higher degree in mechanical or chemical engineering.
At least 5 years using ANSYS Fluent, CFD-DEM Coupling, or similar commercial software.
Proven ability at applying CFD to engineering design improvements.
Solid understanding of particle modelling and particle interaction models such as Hertzian and the Hertz-Mindlin models.
Solid understanding of computational fluid dynamics and excellent grasp of first principles in fluid mechanics and thermodynamics.
Proficiency in AutoDesk Inventor or SolidWorks.
Previous experience with modelling of 2 phase and three phase flow in mixing tanks, pumps, fuel cells and piping networks is desirable.
Knowledge of electrochemistry is desirable.
Compensation:
We promote an open and inclusive environment in which our colleagues are encouraged to be creative and resourceful.
Due to the high volume of applications we receive, only those shortlisted will be contacted.
Thank you for your interest in career opportunities at Zinc8 Energy Solutions Inc..
We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, ancestry, place of origin, religion, family status, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, sex, age, sexual orientation, political belief, or conviction of a criminal or summary conviction offense unrelated to their employment.

Title: EMC Engineer - Delta, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
LabTest Certification Inc. is a Canadian-based Testing, Certification, and Inspection Body with head office in Delta, BC (Canada), and additional locations in Richmond, BC (Canada), Toronto, ON (Canada), and Las Vegas, NV (USA).
We are currently looking for an individual who likes challenges, to fulfill the full-time position as the EMC Engineer in EMC department.
In this role, you will be leading the EMC activities in EMC Department, which involves testing and certification for products used in Residential, Commercial, Industrial, Medical, Military, and other environments, are compliant with the various EMC Emissions and Immunity standards
If you have the following, you may be the person we are looking for!
· Education – Diploma in the Electronics fields preferred
· Strong understanding of RF or EMC and EMC equipment, such as Spectrum Analyzer
· Knowledge of compliance standards such as FCC Part 15 or IEC/EN 61000 series of standard
· Ability to use High-end lab equipment and testing tools such as Oscilloscopes or Spectrum Analyzers
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills
· Ability to work independently and in team settings
· Excellent listening, presentation, and negotiation skills
· Business and customer minded
· Action-oriented and problem solver
· Team-oriented with good interpersonal skills and abilities to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
· Must be self-motivated and client-service oriented
· Wireless testing experience (asset)
If hired, what will you be doing?
Key duties will include, but not limited to, the following:
· Prepare test setups and conduct evaluations following the test plan preparation.
· Prepare and review technical files and reports
· Identify the rationale for compliance or non-compliance; formulates test plans.
· Maintain accurate, orderly and complete test data.
· May identify reasons for inconsistencies between data and expected results.
· Liaison with customers in the design stage to ensure requirements of national/ international standards are met without compromising confidentiality.
· Provide technical guidance and training.
· Answer inquiries regarding standards and legal requirements.
· Coordinate and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
· Ensure all testing assignments are completed systematically on time and within budget.
· Perform witness testing at clients or third party facility, if required
· Help improve test setups so that testing is carried out more effectively
· Prepare test procedures and work instructions
· Complete general administrative work relevant to the project
· Maintain the Equipment database, as assigned
· Build and Develop new test set-up including but not limited to test chambers and software
· Develop and implement custom test set-ups for calibration department
If hired, what will you be receiving?
· Competitive wage
· Vacation pay
· Paid sick days
· A comprehensive health benefits package with Canada Life (after 3-months probationary period)
· Healthy Living Promotion Plan – $100 reimbursement each Quarter of the year to support healthy habits/lifestyle (starts after one year of employment)
· Complimentary staff events
If you are hired, what will be the working conditions?
· Monday to Friday (8 hours workday)
· Traveling may be required (valid passport needed)
Thank you for your interest in joining LabTest Certification.
It is an exciting time to be a part of our growing team!
LabTest is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Title: Civil Engineer - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Welcome to a place where people are at the heart of everything we do.
Welcome to people who like people, to brilliant minds, tomorrow’s visionaries, challenge seekers, collaborators, and those with an entrepreneurial spirit in their DNA.
At CIMA+ you’ll find a place where everyone’s ideas and perspectives are welcomed and encouraged, a place where you’ll have many opportunities to learn and develop while working on projects that rally our team together, where you can proudly become a company shareholder.
At CIMA+, we give you the freedom and flexibility to manage your work on your own terms and define what work-life balance means to you.
At the end of the day, we’re proud to be able to say that when you join CIMA+, we’ll welcome you into a place that you can call home.
Mission
Based in one of our Toronto , the Civil Engineer will be completing assignments on Engineering team under the direct supervision of a Professional Engineer and/or Project Manager. Project involvement will range from site feasibility analysis to detailed design and assistance through the construction phase. The Civil Engineer will assume some project management duties and will interact with clients.
Primary responsibilities
Participate in and oversee the detailed design of civil projects including site layouts, horizontal and vertical control, grading and drainage, parking lot design, municipal infrastructure, site utilities, and associated general civil engineering needs from concept to completion
Preparation of detailed design drawings and contract documents and specifications for project tendering
Take professional responsibility for the designs/tender documents prepared
Make decisions on design and engineering procedures
Provide technical leadership in client and team meetings
Preparation of tender quantities and construction cost estimates
Preparation of technical design reports and studies
Preparation of applications for permits and approvals
Manage project budgets and schedule
Work closely with design / CAD staff to ensure designs meet current design standards, guidelines and other requirements.
May function as technical specialist and/or project coordinator on small to mid-size projects
Provide guidance for professional development to junior engineer-in-training, other civil professional, and technical staff
Some field work/travelling will be required
Profile
A minimum of 5 years of experience in civil / municipal engineering
A Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or higher
Currently accredited with Professional Engineers Ontario (PEO)
Experience working on TTC or Metrolinx projects
Aptitude and demonstrated hands-on experience InRoads, Microstation, Civil 3D, and AutoCAD
Strong computer skills using Microsoft Office Suite
Professional, self-motivated, well organized and detail oriented with the flexibility and ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Excellent interpersonal skills/positive attitude and ability to work in a team atmosphere and cross disciplinary environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent technical report writing skills
Ability to work independently
MTO Class ‘G’ driver’s license in good standing and access to a personal vehicle
Experience in P3 or Alternative delivery project is an asset.
Experience in water resources is an asset
Ethics and integrity are fundamental values at CIMA+, and we are looking for people who uphold these principles. We are committed to creating opportunities for all our talents to contribute to the firm’s success, develop and grow, regardless of cultural or other differences. We fully endorse employment equity principles and encourage women, visible minorities, indigenous people, and individuals with disabilities to apply for any position offered at CIMA+. Adaptation measures are provided upon request to facilitate participation in the recruitment process.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Mechanical Engineer - Nanaimo, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Intermediate Mechanical Engineer
Nanaimo, BC
About Us
Allnorth’s award winning multidisciplinary engineering and technical services team is fortunate to be part of the significant growth of the company over the past few years. Our continuous improvement philosophy, skilled professionals and technical experts have allowed us to take on challenging and exciting projects while servicing clients in the Mining, Oil & Gas, Infrastructure and Pulp & Paper sectors.
Our Opportunity
We are seeking an intermediate mechanical engineer to be based out of our Nanaimo office. As the successful candidate, you will be responsible for the preparation of industrial engineering designs and related documents related to process plant facilities, primarily within the Pulp & Paper and/or Oil & Gas sectors. Familiarity with process equipment selection & layout, piping design & layout and pipe stress analysis to meet pressure piping code compliance is preferred. You will lead or work as part of a team to ensure projects are completed within the project budget and schedule while maintaining a high standard of quality. Please note this position is based out of our Nanaimo office therefore candidates must be local or willing to relocate to the Nanaimo area.
Requirements
Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering
Registered or eligible to register as a Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) in the province of BC. Registration as a Professional Engineer (P.E.) in the USA is desired
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience with conceptual design, front-end loading (FEL) and detailed engineering for industrial process plants is preferred, ideally within the Pulp & Paper and/or Oil & Gas sectors
Experience with engineering and design software for hydraulic analysis, pipe stress analysis, pressure vessel analysis and FEA is preferred
Experience with API and ASME codes
Excellent communication skills (interpersonal and written) and a proven ability to lead and collaborate with team members in a fast-paced multi-disciplined environment
Technical competency and strong attention to detail
What We Offer
Allnorth is dedicated to its Triple Bottom Line of People, Clients & Partners and Profitability. We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team. Become part of our team, and we will provide you with the opportunities to develop personally and professionally. At Allnorth, we encourage a culture of camaraderie and collaboration, working together towards a common goal. You won’t get lost in the numbers here but rather enjoy positive guidance as you learn, grow and create an impact. Now is an exciting time to join the Allnorth team.
Apply
today!
We thank all applicants for their interest. Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

Title: Staff Quality Engineer (Manufacturing) - Mississauga, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview
The Staff Quality Engineer (Day Shift) participates in continuous improvement activities and resolves issues with manufacturing processes and supplier materials for their assigned product line. They ensure the continued effectiveness and compliance of products manufactured from their assigned areas.
*
Snapshot of Responsibilities: *
Conduct investigations related to deviations and supports production and incoming inspection activities
Coordinate Material Review Board activities to gain alignment and agreement on disposition, corrections and corrective actions related to non-conformances
Participate in projects as assigned
Review and approve research design documents, such as Design Verification/Validation Plans/Protocols, Risk Management, Design Inputs and Design Reviews
Review and approve process design documents, such as process validation and process control; participate in manufacturing reviews, design output documents
Review and approve outputs from manufacturing records and inspections
Review and approve manufacturing documents such as instructions, protocols, test methods, process changes and deviations
Review and qualify suppliers providing materials or services for product realization activities
Provide training within the scope of objectives of the assigned work as necessary
May give technical guidance to Quality Inspectors, or other quality staff assigned to work on common projects
Comply with the Health & Safety policies of the company and inform management of unsafe working conditions
Other duties as required
What you bring to the team:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering required
3-6 years related working experience (summer internship, internship or masters) from a regulated industry such as medical device, aeronautical or pharma industries
3-6 years related working experience in manufacturing environment
Knowledge of ISO 13485 or ISO 9001
Excellent analytical and communication skills (written and oral)
Excellent organization and time management skills
Interest in biomedical or health-related industry
What we have to offer:
*
Smart commute options including complimentary shuttle from Kipling Station, and subsidized transit program.
Flexible working hours that complement core business hours.
One day off for volunteering, to give back to a charitable organization of your choice.
Purposeful work that drives career development, with opportunities to learn and grow by way of on-site training, workshops, and lunch and learn sessions.
Comprehensive total rewards package, including tuition reimbursement and lifestyle and health spending account.
Well-being initiatives, including onsite gym facility and fitness classes (yoga and boot camp).
Employee-friendly work environment, with opportunity to participate in employee-led clubs, organized sports teams, video games, foosball, ping pong, etc.
About Us
At Baylis Medical, everyone works with a shared purpose: to improve the lives of people around the world. Named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, we are a rapidly growing leader in the development, manufacturing and commercialization of innovative medical devices in the field of cardiology. Our focus is on providing physicians clinically-relevant tools, so that no patient goes untreated.
We are looking for talented individuals, like yourself, to join Baylis Medical and make an impact in the lives of patients. Are you ready to join us?
Baylis Medical is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment, while providing ongoing education for all employees. Title: Biomedical Engineering Career Opportunities Across the Lower Mainland - British Columbia - Indeed.com
Description:
Biomedical Engineering for Providence Health Care (PHC), Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA), Fraser Health (FH) and Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH), is committed to supporting employees in use of medical technology for effective patient care.
Recognized as four of British Columbia largest healthcare employers with over 60,000 employees, working with multidisciplinary teams, Biomedical Engineering provides a high level of consultation and involvement in the areas of device maintenance, patient safety, education, procurement, budgeting, planning, projects and design in regards to medical technology. Our approach is, to “apply best practices and knowledge from scope of resources to address medical technology issues at the point of patient care” to guide our efforts to align Biomedical Engineering and Programs as a single corporate entity.

Electromagnetic Engineer

Partner with the best

Physics, Electronics/Electrical Engineering degree or equivalent

Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills
Great oral and written communication skills.

Title: Manufacturing Engineer - Saskatoon, SK - Indeed.com
Description:
Manufacturing Engineer
Calian is a Canadian-based, publicly traded company that prides itself in its international reputation for excellence and long-standing history of continual growth. This opportunity is within the Advanced Technologies (AT) division, based out of our research location in the north industrial area of Saskatoon, called Calian Composites (formerly SED Research Inc). Calian Composites is an offshoot of Calian AT, focusing on the fabrication and use of advanced composites for satcom and other industries.
Recently, AT has developed carbon fiber composite antennas for the next wave of high bandwidth internet-over-satellite. To continue the endeavor into cutting edge manufacturing technologies, we are looking for individuals who share our passion for new and innovative ideas.
Calian is looking for dynamic and passionate Manufacturing Engineer to join our team. Reporting to the Manager of Composite Engineering, you will be an integral member of the team and will be responsible for supporting design and manufacturing of new and existing products.
Responsibilities:
Initiate, oversee, and implement lean manufacturing initiatives
Develop and maintain work instructions for production
Evaluate the safety of new products on the shop floor
Design and construct jigs, fixtures, etc.
Support quoting, project planning, and project management on initiatives and projects
Mentor and train staff
Support the development of new manufacturing methods or technologies
Define and implement workflows, and support the shop floor layout
Prepare and implement engineering change orders
Assist in management of the bill of materials and other documentation
Requirements:
Degree in manufacturing, mechanical, industrial engineering or demonstrated experience
Minimum 5+ years of relevant experience
Experience with composite material manufacturing is preferred
Experience in CAD is an asset
Why
Work for Calian?
A casual, team-oriented work environment that promotes learning, collaboration, and skill improvement

Title: Engineer V - Mactaquac, NB - Indeed.com
Description:
One (1) Regular Position
Mactaquac Generating Station, Mactaquac, New Brunswick, Canada
Competition #
E19437-2021
At NB Power, we work hard every day to provide reliable, safe and sustainable energy. We’re committed to a vision of sustainable energy for future generations. Why? Because we’re New Brunswickers too. We have over 2,600 employees across New Brunswick who are dedicated to where they live and work. Together, we deliver energy solutions to more than 400,000 New Brunswickers at home, work and in their community.
The Hydro Technical Services Team is responsible for providing technical guidance to the Maintenance, Planning, and Operation departments within the Hydro Region to support overall plant safety, reliability, and availability.
As a member of this team, the Engineer V is the engineering lead with regards to design and operation of the core mechanical systems and components of a hydro turbine and supports all Hydro stations when engineering or technical issues arise during running work, outages, and capital projects.
Key Responsibilities include:
Developing and/or facilitating the development of the required engineering drawings, technical specifications, tenders, troubleshooting plans, bids, technical proposals, RFQs, RFPs, engineering reports, etc. to support safe and efficient plant operation.
Providing technical direction during the development and review of maintenance tasks (e.g. PIMs) and operating procedures for equipment and/or systems. In addition, providing direction, both written and oral, to plant staff, vendors, and contractors to assist in the repair or modification of plant equipment and systems or during the testing or commissioning of new and/or refurbished equipment and systems.
Overseeing and leading large engineering projects and supporting the various plants during the planning and execution of the work to ensure the work is completed in a quality manner.
Inspecting and evaluating all Hydro units during their planned and forced outages and documenting the overall condition, including what work was performed. The incumbent will also include any deficiencies and ensure a corrective notification is created in SAP.
Supporting the Mactaquac Life Achievement Project Team on potential turbine and generator design options and other fundamental systems and components related to Hydro generation.
The ideal candidate will have:
Bachelor of Engineering – Mechanical
AND
Registered as P.Eng. with APEGNB or eligible to do so
AND
Valid Class 5 Drivers License.
Minimum of five years direct working experience in a Hydro-powered generating station in a technical role.
10 years working experience (i.e. design, operation, and/or maintenance) in a heavy industrial environment with a primary focus on large rotating equipment, such as turbines and generators.
An intimate working knowledge in cranes, pumps, motors, gearboxes, pressure piping systems, non-destructive testing methods, QA/QC oversight, welding methods, HVAC systems, bearings, vibration monitoring, vertical gates, and governor systems.
Intermediate skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Project and SAP are required.
An equivalent combination of training and experience will be considered. Subject to competition response, the minimum qualifications may be modified.
An Eligibility List generated from this competition may be used to fill future vacancies at the same level within a period of up to 12 months.
Please ensure a resume and a copy of your degree/diploma/certificate are attached to your online application.
NB Power will accept foreign credentials as long as they are considered acceptable by a recognized Canadian educational institution. Candidates with foreign education credentials are required to provide proof of Canadian equivalency. Any applicable fees are the responsibility of the candidate. For more information, you may refer to the Canadian Information Centre of International Credentials at Canadian Information Centre of International Credentials: https://www.cicic.ca/1374/obtain_an_academic_credential_assessment_for_general_purposes.canada
In order to be considered for this employment opportunity you must be eligible to work in Canada.
Please note that only applications submitted through the NB Power website will be considered, as the showing of our postings on various websites may not have been requested or approved.
For questions concerning this job opening please contact
Sonia Grenier
at careers@nbpower.com
Closing date: 11:59 p.m. AST, November 30, 2021
NB Power is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to workforce diversity

Title: Quality Engineer - Bradford, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview:
Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in “Automotive News.” A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.
Scope of the Position:
The Quality Engineer supports and promotes plant wide quality improvement efforts. Lead and maintain PPAP Process and supporting functions. Evaluate and develop improvement techniques for quality and reliability. Maintain and report on the quality systems using Process Audits (Layered, Flex-N-Gate, Customer required, Control plan audits). Works with employees, suppliers and customers to produce quality products that meet or exceed the customer and plant's requirements.
Responsibilities:
Handle customer issues. Review customer testing requirements and ensure that systems are in place to meet them.
Work with suppliers to ensure testing requirements are being met and over see PPAP process.
Ensure production is producing quality product to specifications.
Support upkeep of the calibration system. Maintain records, ensure gages and equipment are calibrated within required time.
Provide support onsite to customer/suppliers as needed.
Support prototype builds (document according to prototype checklist inspection process).
Collect SPC data and report monthly; and work with manufacturing on process improvements.
Support manufacturing in the development of job instructions and procedures.
Document all activities as required.
Provide support and maintain compliance with all company guidelines, union contracts, TS16949, ISO14001, and all applicable government regulations and standards.
Define and implement “Customers indicators” to monitor the satisfaction level of the customer and reporting back to management.
Makes decisions with regard to disposition of non-conforming material and that proper containment and follow up is done.
Perform additional assignments per manager’s direction.
Advise on improvements in tracking and reporting procedures
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or related technology or equivalent.
CQE (ASQ) certification preferred.
Minimum of 4 years experience in a manufacturing facility that offered the opportunity to gain a well rounded background in quality engineering.
Must have APQP experience
Knowledge of production process, machines, tools, including design and uses.
Strong organizational skills.
Strong communication skills (both verbal and written).
Proficiency with database applications and administration systems, specifically Microsoft Office and the use of statistical software.
Ability to work effectively alone and prioritize.
Must be a highly motivated, service and team-oriented individual with an attention to detail.
Enthusiasm for challenge and new initiatives are prerequisites.
Strong analytical ability
Supervisory and interpersonal skills are required
Troubleshooting ability is required
Benefits:
Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
RRSP retirement savings plan
Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
Paid holidays and vacation time
What do our employees have to say?
“It engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.”
“Lots of growth opportunity.”
“The company’s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.”
Not just a job—a great place to work!
Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer. Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

Title: ENGINEER, SENIOR (Salary) - Edmonton, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Minimum Clearance Required to Start:
Not Applicable/None
Job Description:
Ready to lead a team that tackles infrastructure challenges? Want to take your Engineering expertise to the next level to work on tough projects that will make a huge impact on the community?
Parsons is now hiring experienced Engineers with a desire to work on infrastructure projects that change the fabric of our community. Parsons extensive experience in this field, combined with your engineering knowledge, will propel your career forward with opportunity for advancement with top performance. We need our Senior Engineers to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team oriented environment and who have exceptional communication, analytical and management skills. In this role you will Complete a wide variety of difficult engineering assignments, applying engineering techniques and analyses within one discipline. You will apply advanced engineering techniques and analyses which may involve CAE (computer aided engineering)/CAD (computer aided design) applications. Willingness to travel or relocate to supplier, client, or construction site locations is expected.
Responsibilities:
Performs complex engineering tasks and particularly important engineering work efficiently and accurately.
Extracts engineering information from CAD drawings. Prepares engineering computations, material quantity takeoffs, estimates, surveys, and designs.
Completes a variety of assignments such as drawings, specifications, and other materials suitable for procurement and construction purposes.
Frequently interfaces with other Engineering disciplines as well as other departments.
Prepares detailed requisitions for equipment and materials.
Reviews supplier drawing submittals and performs technical bid analyses.
Prepares and issues specifications, data sheets, and other construction documents.
Provides technical guidance to CAD Designer/Drafters, Designers, and lower level Engineers working on the same project.
May be required to provide the seal and signature of the professional engineer, as appropriate, ensuring compliance with all applicable codes, regulations, and ordinances.
May act in an advisory capacity to senior management personnel on engineering related matters.
Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering (or related field) and 8+ years of related work experience
Professional Engineer registration may be required
Proficiency in utilizing CAD and other PC software packages typically associated with engineering is required
